p: Thermal conditions started to change in the region since the beginning of the 1980s. In 1981, thermal conditions for malaria were better than ever. Since then, a rising trend has been observed ( Figure 8). This is demonstrated by the SEI becoming longer. This prolongation is due, to some extent, to an earlier beginning of SEI, but is mostly due to its delayed ending. The index of favorability K f that we proposed is also on the rise, and seems to be a reliable indicator of the quality of weather in relation to malaria.
